alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coke; Nolan; Runnels; Taylor; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 10:34PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Coke, west central Callahan, southeastern Nolan, north central Tom Green, southern Taylor and northwestern Runnels Counties through 1115 PM CST... At 1034 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hylton to near Bronte to near Carlsbad. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winters, Robert Lee, Blackwell, Maverick, Bronte, Tuscola, Buffalo Gap, Lawn, Bradshaw, Hatchel, Hylton, Orient, Potosi, Norton, Water Valley, Wingate, Happy Valley, Fort Chadbourne, Coronados Camp and Tennyson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Callahan; Coke; Nolan; Runnels; Taylor; Tom Green
